episodeTitle: Clash! Demon-Slasher Zoro vs. Ship-Slasher T Bone!
titleJapanese: 激突！鬼斬りゾロVS船斬りTボーン
titleRomanized: Gekitotsu! Onigiri Zoro tai Funegiri Tī-Bōn
description: Zoro defeats Marine Captain T Bone in a quick clash on the sea train tracks. Sanji overcomes Wanze's ramen techniques and defeats him, while Franky gains the upper hand against Nero using his Ultimate Hammer. Both Sanji and Franky then face off against CP9 agents.

events.title: Zoro Confronts T Bone
events.description: Zoro encounters Marine Captain T Bone on the sea train tracks after seeing the sliced Sea King. T Bone, ashamed for falling into a trap and missing the Puffing Tom, faces off against Zoro as the Rocketman approaches.
events.significance: Sets up the episode's main battle and demonstrates T Bone's dedication to duty and his formidable reputation as a swordsman capable of cutting ships and Sea Kings.

events.title: T Bone's Chokkaku Hicho: Bone Odori
events.description: T Bone unleashes his signature technique, Chokkaku Hicho: Bone Odori (Right Angle Flying Bird: Bone Dance), a powerful angular slash attack that can cut through ships and Sea Kings. He charges at Zoro with this technique.
events.significance: First appearance of T Bone's signature fighting technique, showcasing his unique 'Right Angle Fencing' style that generates powerful angular slashes.

quotes.speaker: T Bone
quotes.context: T Bone unleashes his signature attack against Zoro

events.title: Zoro's Gyuki Yuzume Debuts
events.description: Zoro counters T Bone's attack with Gyuki Yuzume (Bull Ogre Brave Claw), a Three Sword Style technique where he positions all three swords pointing at the enemy and lunges forward with great impact, shattering T Bone's sword and defeating him instantly.
events.significance: Introduction of a new Santoryu technique in Zoro's arsenal. The quick victory demonstrates Zoro's significant growth in strength since entering the Grand Line, as he easily defeats someone capable of cutting through Sea Kings.

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro uses his new technique to defeat T Bone

events.title: Zoro Defeats T Bone
events.description: T Bone's sword shatters from the impact of Zoro's attack, and he is sent flying into the water. Zoro compliments T Bone's strength as the Franky Family cheers for Zoro's victory. Zoro then boards the Rocketman to continue the pursuit.
events.significance: Establishes Zoro's current power level and his readiness to face stronger opponents ahead. T Bone, despite his reputation, is quickly defeated, showing the Straw Hats' progression.

events.title: Sanji vs Wanze Continues
events.description: On the Puffing Tom, Sanji continues his fight against Wanze, the CP7 agent and ramen chef who fights using noodle-based techniques. Wanze uses his bizarre Ramen Kenpo fighting style.
events.significance: Continuation of the battle that began in the previous episode, showcasing Wanze's unusual combat abilities and Sanji's determination to reach Robin.

events.title: Wanze's Ramen Techniques
events.description: Wanze demonstrates his unique Ramen Kenpo techniques including Hocho Nage (knife throwing) and Men-Kiri Doku Bocho (noodle-cutting poison knife), utilizing ramen noodles produced from his nose as weapons and armor.
events.significance: Showcases one of the more bizarre fighting styles in One Piece, emphasizing the series' creative and comedic approach to combat.

events.title: Sanji's Facial Technique Barrage
events.description: Sanji declares Wanze guilty of three sins: calling himself a chef, disrespecting food, and insulting his friend. He unleashes a barrage of precise facial kicks: Œil (eye), Nez (nose), Joue (cheek), Bouche (mouth), Dents (teeth), and Menton (chin), temporarily reshaping Wanze's face into a handsome appearance.
events.significance: Introduction of Sanji's precision facial attack techniques, named after French words for facial features. The comedic transformation of Wanze's face adds humor while demonstrating Sanji's surgical precision in combat.

quotes.text: You're guilty of three sins: You called yourself a 'chef' in front of me, you were disrespectful toward your food, and you insulted my friend!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji confronts Wanze before unleashing his attack

events.title: Parage Shot Transformation
events.description: Sanji's Parage Shot technique temporarily transforms Wanze's face into a beautiful, bishonen appearance. Wanze is horrified, believing his face has been ruined, creating a comedic moment in the battle.
events.significance: First use of Sanji's Parage Shot, a technique that later becomes significant in the Thriller Bark arc. Demonstrates Sanji's incredible kicking precision and adds comedy to the intense pursuit of Robin.

events.title: Santen Découpage Finisher
events.description: Sanji delivers the final blow to Wanze with Santen Découpage, a powerful three-part kick technique. The attack returns Wanze's face to normal but sends him flying through two train cars directly into the car where CP9 is waiting.
events.significance: Sanji's victory over Wanze sets up his imminent confrontation with CP9. The power of the attack demonstrates Sanji's strength and determination to rescue Robin.

events.title: Sanji Defeats Wanze
events.description: Wanze is knocked through the train cars by Sanji's final attack, landing in the CP9 car. Sanji has successfully defeated the CP7 agent and cleared his path forward on the Puffing Tom.
events.significance: Removes one obstacle between Sanji and Robin, allowing him to advance toward the CP9 agents. Shows Sanji's growth and dedication to saving his crewmate.

events.title: Franky vs Nero Intensifies
events.description: On the roof of the Puffing Tom, Franky's battle with Nero continues. Nero uses his Rokushiki techniques including Rankyaku: Sen and Geppo to attack from the air, while Franky defends with his Star Shield and counterattacks with nails.
events.significance: Showcases Nero's partial mastery of CP9's Rokushiki techniques and Franky's cyborg abilities, setting up Franky's eventual victory.

events.title: Nero's Rokushiki Techniques
events.description: Nero demonstrates his partial knowledge of Rokushiki, using Rankyaku: Sen (air slash), Geppo (air walk), and pulling out pistols to compensate for his inability to use Shigan. He reveals he has mastered only four of the six Rokushiki techniques.
events.significance: Establishes Nero as an incomplete CP9 agent, foreshadowing his eventual fate. His reliance on pistols shows his limitations compared to full CP9 members.

events.title: Franky's Ultimate Hammer
events.description: Franky tricks Nero into attacking, then locks down Nero's arms and legs before unleashing Ultimate Hammer, a powerful attack that smashes Nero through the roof of the train car down into the interior where CP9 is waiting.
events.significance: First appearance of Franky's Ultimate Hammer technique. The attack showcases Franky's strategic fighting style and his impressive strength as a cyborg.

events.title: Franky Defeats Nero
events.description: Nero is smashed through the roof by Franky's Ultimate Hammer and crashes into the CP9 car. He attempts to recover and stand up, but his defeat has brought him face-to-face with the full CP9 agents.
events.significance: Franky's victory over Nero demonstrates his combat capabilities and brings both Franky and Sanji into direct confrontation with CP9.

events.title: Rob Lucci Executes Nero
events.description: In the CP9 car, Rob Lucci coldly explains that Nero is too weak because he only mastered four of the six Rokushiki forms. Lucci gives Nero three seconds to escape, but when Nero tries to run, Lucci attacks him with multiple Shigan strikes to the back, gravely wounding him before throwing his body into the ocean during the Aqua Laguna storm.
events.significance: This brutal execution establishes Lucci's ruthless nature and CP9's merciless standards. It foreshadows the deadly threat that CP9 poses to the Straw Hats and demonstrates that weakness is not tolerated in the organization. This is a shocking moment that raises the stakes for the rescue mission.

quotes.text: He's too weak. He only knows four of the forms.
quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci
quotes.context: Lucci explaining why Nero doesn't deserve to be in CP9

events.title: Sanji and Franky Face CP9
events.description: After their respective victories, both Sanji and Franky find themselves in the CP9 car, facing the full roster of CP9 agents: Rob Lucci, Kaku, Kalifa, and Blueno. The confrontation sets up the next phase of the battle as they attempt to rescue Robin.
events.significance: The first direct confrontation between the Straw Hats' side and CP9 on the Puffing Tom. This moment marks the transition from fighting underlings to facing the true threats standing between them and Robin.

quotes.speaker: T Bone
quotes.context: T Bone's signature attack against Zoro

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro defeats T Bone with his Three Sword Style technique

quotes.text: You're guilty of three sins: You called yourself a 'chef' in front of me, you were disrespectful toward your food, and you insulted my friend!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji confronts Wanze before defeating him

quotes.text: He's too weak. He only knows four of the forms.
quotes.speaker: Rob Lucci
quotes.context: Lucci explaining why Nero doesn't deserve to be in CP9 before executing him

themes.description: The episode demonstrates how much stronger the Straw Hats have become, with Zoro easily defeating a Marine captain capable of cutting Sea Kings, and Sanji and Franky overcoming CP7 and CP9 trainee opponents.
themes.symbolism: The quick victories represent the crew's readiness to face the challenges ahead at Enies Lobby.

themes.description: CP9's execution of Nero highlights the organization's brutal philosophy where weakness is not tolerated. This contrasts sharply with the Straw Hats' compassion for their allies.
themes.symbolism: Lucci's cold execution of Nero represents the dark side of absolute justice and foreshadows the moral conflict to come.

themes.description: Sanji's declaration that Wanze insulted his friend shows the crew's unwavering loyalty to Robin and their determination to rescue her no matter the cost.
themes.symbolism: The three battles happening simultaneously on different trains represents the unified effort of the Straw Hats and their allies to save Robin.

themes.description: Sanji's anger at Wanze for disrespecting food and calling himself a chef emphasizes Sanji's deep respect for culinary arts and his professional pride as a cook.
themes.symbolism: Wanze's misuse of food as weapons represents a perversion of cooking that Sanji must correct.

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates significant power growth by easily defeating T Bone, a Marine captain capable of cutting Sea Kings and ships. Shows respect for his opponent despite the quick victory.
keyActions: Confronts T Bone on the sea train tracks
Shatters T Bone's sword and defeats him
Boards the Rocketman to continue pursuit

characterSpotlights.development: Shows his dedication to rescuing Robin and his pride as a chef. Demonstrates precise kicking techniques and introduces several new moves to his arsenal.
keyActions: Uses precise facial strikes to reshape Wanze's face
quotes: You're guilty of three sins: You called yourself a 'chef' in front of me, you were disrespectful toward your food, and you insulted my friend!

characterSpotlights.development: Proves his combat abilities against a CP9 trainee, using strategy and his cyborg enhancements to overcome Nero's Rokushiki techniques.
keyActions: Battles Nero on the train roof
Uses Star Shield to defend against Rankyaku

characterSpotlights.development: Establishes his ruthless nature and CP9's brutal standards by executing Nero for being too weak. This moment reveals Lucci's cold, merciless personality.
keyActions: Judges Nero as too weak for CP9
Gives Nero three seconds to escape
Attacks Nero with multiple Shigan strikes
quotes: He's too weak. He only knows four of the forms.

characterSpotlights.development: Shows his dedication to duty despite falling into a trap. His quick defeat demonstrates the power gap between regular Marines and the Straw Hats.
keyActions: Runs to catch the Puffing Tom
Has his sword shattered by Zoro

characterSpotlights.development: Provides comic relief with his bizarre ramen-based fighting style. His transformation by Sanji's Parage Shot creates a memorable comedic moment.
keyActions: Has face transformed by Parage Shot

characterSpotlights.development: His incomplete mastery of Rokushiki and subsequent execution by Lucci serves as a dark reminder of CP9's merciless standards.
keyActions: Battles Franky using four Rokushiki techniques
Reveals he cannot use Shigan, compensates with pistols
Gets defeated by Franky's Ultimate Hammer
Gets executed by Lucci and thrown into ocean

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the battles slightly with additional action sequences and reactions from the Franky Family aboard the Rocketman.
Additional scenes showing the Straw Hats and Franky Family on the Rocketman reacting to Zoro's victory were added for pacing.

trivia.fact: This episode aired on April 2, 2006, and achieved a TV rating of 13.9%, ranking #1 in its time slot.
Gyuki Yuzume means 'Bull Ogre Brave Claw' and is one of Zoro's Three Sword Style techniques that can also be performed in mid-air.

sources.title: Three Sword Style - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: This is the last episode to use 'Asu wa Kuru Kara' by Tohoshinki as the ending theme, as it only ran from episodes 256-263.

sources.title: Asu wa Kuru Kara - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Sanji's Parage Shot technique, which debuted in this episode, later plays a significant role in the Thriller Bark arc when used on Duval.
The episode eyecatcher features Zoro and Sanji, highlighting their parallel battles against opponents on different trains.
T Bone's epithet 'Ship-Cutter' comes from his ability to cut through entire ships with his sword techniques, similar to how he cut the Sea King in half.
This episode was broadcast in widescreen format (16:9 HDTV), as Kokoro no Chizu was the first One Piece opening to be aired in widescreen.

sources.title: Kokoro no Chizu - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Nero's death/presumed death makes him one of the few characters shown being executed by CP9 for failure, emphasizing the organization's ruthless nature.
